Jameson is a not-for-profit agency established in 1928 to serve the youth of central Indiana who have special needs.

This event is designed to be fun for campers, their families, friends of the camp, neighbors, staff, and anyone interested in finding out more about Jameson.

The camp offers summer residential programs for children from ages 7-17, and continues contact with the campers and their families with special overnight and weekend follow-up events during the school year.
This event is designed to be fun for campers, their families, friends of the camp, neighbors, staff, and anyone interested in finding out more about Jameson.
Many of the children have learning disabilities, behavioral problems, or come from economically distressed families.
